# **Nationalratswahlen Kanton Thurgau: Mandatsverteilung nach Geschlecht auf Ebene Kanton**

[Link to dataset on data.tg.ch](https://data.tg.ch/explore/dataset/sk-stat-122/information/)

## Description

<p>Dieser Dataset präsentiert die Ergebnisse der Nationalratswahlen für den Kanton Thurgau (Kandidaturen, Geschlecht der Kandidierenden, Gewählt/Nicht Gewählt) ab 1971.</p><p>Datenquelle: Bundesamt für Statistik BFS / Staatskanzlei Kanton Thurgau (2023<span style='font-size: 0.875rem;'>, Datenstand: 30.10.2023</span><span style='font-family: inherit; font-size: 0.875rem;'>)</span></p><p>Link zur PX-Tabelle:  <a href='https://www.pxweb.bfs.admin.ch/pxweb/de/px-x-1702020000_104/-/px-x-1702020000_104.px/' style='background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400;' target='_blank'>https://www.pxweb.bfs.admin.ch/pxweb/de/px-x-1702020000_103/-/px-x-1702020000_103.px/</a><br></p><p><br></p>

## Load Packages

Every dataset (csv and geodata) on [data.tg.ch](https://data.tg.ch/pages/start/) can be retrieved with the **tgAPI** package. You can download it via [GitHub](https://github.com/ogdtg/tgAPI). Please note that the package has some dependencies, which can result in a lengthy installation process. Therefore, we do not recommend installing the package directly in Google Colab. However, if you intend to run this code on your local machine, we strongly recommend installing the tgAPI package.

```{r}
library(httr)
library(jsonlite)
library(dplyr)
# library(remotes)
# remotes::install.github("ogdtg/tgAPI")

```


## Download Data


```{r}
# Download the Dataset via API
res <- httr::GET("https://data.tg.ch/api/explore/v2.0/catalog/datasets/sk-stat-122/exports/json")
data <- res$content %>%
  rawToChar() %>%
  jsonlite::fromJSON()

# Use tgAPI
# data <- tgAPI::get_dataset("sk-stat-122")

head(data)

```


## Explore Metadata

```{r}

res <- httr::GET("https://data.tg.ch/api/explore/v2.0/catalog/datasets/sk-stat-122")
metadata <- res$content %>%

  jsonlite::fromJSON()

# Fields name
cat("\nFields name")
metadata$dataset$fields$name

# Fields description
cat("\nFields description")
metadata$dataset$fields$description

# Fields data type

metadata$dataset$fields$type

```
